org.miniauth.oauth.common

Class OAuthIncomingRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.miniauth.common.RequestBase
      • org.miniauth.common.IncomingRequest
        • org.miniauth.oauth.common.OAuthIncomingRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class OAuthIncomingRequest
extends IncomingRequest
    Provider side request, which is sent by a client, for services that use OAuth. Note that OAuthIncomingRequest does not represent a full request. It's just a partial wrapper for attributes that are needed for OAuth signature verification.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • prepare

        public IncomingRequest prepare()
                        throws MiniAuthException
        Put this request object in a "ready" state. The request object can be verified only if it's in a ready state.
        Specified by:
        prepare in class IncomingRequest
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        MiniAuthException - if preparation fails, or the object cannot be put into the "ready" state.

      • verify

        public IncomingRequest verify()
                       throws MiniAuthException
        Put this request object in a "verified" state. This is the second of the two "state changing" operations. This can be called only if the current state == ready. Note that it does not actually "verify" anything. The verification should be done by the caller.
        Overrides:
        verify in class IncomingRequest
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        MiniAuthException - if the IncomingRequest cannot be put into the "verified" state.

      • isEndorsed

        public boolean isEndorsed()
                   throws MiniAuthException
        Returns true if this incoming request has been "endorsed" (e.g., by the client/caller) (e.g., if it includes the oauth_signature param in the case of OAuth, etc.). Endorsed==true does not mean it's verified.
        Specified by:
        isEndorsed in class IncomingRequest
        Returns:
        the "endorsement" state of this request.
        Throws:
        MiniAuthException
